Detailed Description

Simple MOOS program that uses the WHOI Micromodem for acoustic communication (see http://acomms.whoi.edu/micromodem/).

The program is able to send pings, transmit data and receive data. Ping time values are stored in the MOOS variable PING_TIME and message data is stored in the variable specified in the configuration block of pACom.

Even though this is a MOOS application most of the code relies very little on MOOS. This allows the code to be used in applications outside MOOS.

Port setting, like baudrate, are still hardcode, this might change later on.

Member Function Documentation

bool CpACom::initModem (   )  [protected]
 

Uses the string from initCommands to initialize the modem.

The address given by srcModem is also set here.

Returns:
true if the modem was successfully initialized, false otherwise.

bool CpACom::Iterate (   ) 
 

Called AppTick times per second, but all program executions are preformed in the different threads.

ùX¬

Returns:
true if no error error accrued, false otherwise.

bool CpACom::OnConnectToServer (   ) 
 

Called when successfully connected to the server.

Returns:
true if the application successfully connected to the MOOSDB, false otherwise.

bool CpACom::OnDisconnectFromServer (   ) 
 

Called when successfully disconnecting server.

Returns:
true if the application successfully disconnected the MOOSDB, false otherwise.

bool CpACom::OnNewMail (  MOOSMSG_LIST &  NewMail  ) 
 

All MOOS variables are updated here.

Returns:
true if the mail was successfully read.

bool CpACom::OnStartUp (   ) 
 

Called when the application starts.

Starts the different threads, pingThread, sendThread or readThread depending on Boolean variables in configuration block for pACom.

Returns:
true if the application started up successfully, false otherwise.

int CpACom::openSerialPort (   )  [protected]
 

Open serial port given by SerialPort in the configuration block for pACom.

NB! Port options like baudrate are are hardcoded.

Code obtained from http://www.easysw.com/~mike/serial/serial.html

Returns:
the file descriptor on success or -1 on error.

void CpACom::ping (   ) 
 

Sends a ping.

The destination modem automatically responds to the ping and the source modem reads the response time and posts that value in the MOOS variable PING_TIME.

This function is called every ping_delay seconds specified in the configuration block for pACom.

bool CpACom::readData (   ) 
 

Called by the read data thread, readThread(), and polls the modem every read_delay seconds for a total length of RECIVE_TIMEOUT.

Data is stored in the MOOS variables specified by configuration block.

Returns:
true if data was read successfully false otherwise.

int CpACom::readFromSerialPort (  string &  msg  )  [protected]
 

Reads from the serial port.

Parameters:
msg the message read from the port.
Returns:
the number of bytes read.

bool CpACom::ReadMissionFile (   )  [protected]
 

Reads the settings from the configuration block for pACom.

The variables serialPort, srcModem, dstModem, initCommands will be set here.

Returns:
true if the file was read successfully, false otherwise.

bool CpACom::sendData (   ) 
 

Sends the MOOS variable values for the variables specified in the configuration block for pACom.

Called by the send data thread, sendThread(), where it sends data to the port in intervals specified by send_delay in the configuration pACom. Function blocks the port for SEND_TIMEOUT seconds.

Returns:
true if the data was successfully sent to the port, false otherwise.

int CpACom::writeToSerialPort (  string  msg  )  [protected]
 

Writes to the serial port.

Parameters:
msg the message to write, which has to be less then MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH.
Returns:
the number of bytes sent or -1 if an error occurred.

Member Data Documentation

int CpACom::BUFFER_SIZE [private]
 

The input buffer size in bytes.

It is assumed that the data on the serial port is in ASCII, so a single character is 1 byte. So this is the total size of the buffer + 1 in bytes.

int CpACom::BYTE_LIMIT [private]
 

The least number of bytes to be regarded as a transmission.

Sometimes when sending a message a single byte can be echoed back. Any message with a byte size less then this will be disregarded.

string CpACom::initCommands [private]
 

Modem initialization commands are stored here.

The command for modem source address is set automatically by initModem().

int CpACom::MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH [private]
 

The maximum message length when sending.

Sending is done in ASCII where a single character is 1 byte. So this is the total in bytes.

vector<string > CpACom::moosVariables [private]
 

Use the names when sending receiving moos variables.

That is the MOOSDB mapped names are stored here. Check your .moos file for more info.

string CpACom::packetType [private]
 

Packet typ to use when sending data.


packet type frames bytes/frame bytes/packet bps
0 1 32 32 80
1 3 32 96 250
2 2 64 192 500
3 2 256 512 1200
4 2 256 512 1300
5 8 256 2048 5300

bool CpACom::toCompressData [private]
 

Set true if data should be sent in a predefined format.

No variable names will be sent, but just their values so that they fit in one 32 byte message.

bool CpACom::toSendPing [private]
 

Set true if the modem is pinging.

N.B! Only source modem needs this set to true. Destination modem will respond to pings automatically.
